Provides infrastructure for building flexible and efficient HTTP servers and clients.

Imports

uv, error, timers, future, streams, net, strtabs, strutils, parseutils

Types

  conn: TcpConnection
  reader: HttpReader
  writer: HttpWriter
Abstraction for HTTP request.   Source Edit 
ServerRequest = ref object of HttpRequest
Incominng HTTP request on server.   Source Edit

  hostname: string
  port: Port
  domain: Domain
  connecting: bool
HTTP reqeust made by client.   Source Edit

Close the internal TCP connection, connection is no longer available.   Source Edit 
proc readLine(req: HttpRequest; buf: pointer; size: int): Future[int] {.

    raises: [FutureError], tags: [RootEffect]
.}

Reads a line of data from the internal connection to buf. Returned future will complete once a full line is read or an error occurs.

size is length of buf, it must be not less than HeaderBufSize. This function is mainly used for optimization purposes.

  Source Edit 
proc readLine(req: HttpRequest): Future[string] {.
raises: [FutureError],
    tags: [RootEffect]
.}

Reads a line of data from the internal connection. Returned future will complete once a full line is read or an error occurs.

If the line's length is greater than HeaderBufSize, raise an error.

  Source Edit 
proc readChunk(req: HttpRequest; buf: pointer; size: int; immediate = true): Future[int] {.

    raises: [FutureError], tags: [RootEffect]
.}

Reads up to size bytes from HTTP request, storing the results in the buf. This function will attempt to read all the requested data until end of file if immediate is true.

The return value is the number of bytes actually read. This might be less than size; for example, if there aren’t that many bytes left in the file or if there aren’t that many bytes immediately available.

When reached end of a request, returns 0. Or raise NodeError on error.

This function returns a decoded result for Transfer-Encoding: chunked HTTP request. An error occured if size less then the length of a chunk. Make sure size is long enough.

  Source Edit 
proc readChunk(req: HttpRequest; size: int; immediate = true): Future[string] {.

    raises: [FutureError], tags: [RootEffect]
.}

Reads up to size bytes from HTTP request, returns the results. This function will attempt to read all the requested data until end of file if immediate is true.

The return value is the number of bytes actually read. This might be less than size; for example, if there aren’t that many bytes left in the file or if there aren’t that many bytes immediately available.

When reached end of a request, returns "". Or raise NodeError on error.

  Source Edit 
proc writeChunk(req: HttpRequest; buf: pointer; size: int): Future[void] {.

    raises: [FutureError], tags: [RootEffect]
.}

Writes up to size-2 bytes from buf to the HTTP request. The returned future will complete once all data has been written.

For Transfer-Encoding: chunked HTTP request this function will encode data, size must be two longer then the real length of buf to hold the last \r\L.

  Source Edit 
proc writeChunk(req: HttpRequest; buf: string): Future[void] {.

    raises: [FutureError], tags: [RootEffect]
.}

Writes up to size-2 bytes from buf to the HTTP request. The returned future will complete once all data has been written.

For Transfer-Encoding: chunked HTTP request this function will encode data.

  Source Edit 
proc readHead(req: ServerRequest): Future[tuple[httpVersionMajor: int,
    httpVersionMinor: int, reqMethod: string, url: string, headers: StringTableRef]] {.

    raises: [FutureError], tags: [RootEffect]
.}
Reads the whole header from incoming HTTP request, returns the results.
> Note: Be careful to handle HTTP request which supported keep-alive. For persistent
connection via keep-alive, there are usually multiple requests.
  Source Edit 
proc readHead(req: ClientRequest): Future[tuple[httpVersionMajor: int,
    httpVersionMinor: int, statusCode: int, statusMessage: string,
    headers: StringTableRef]] {.
raises: [FutureError], tags: [RootEffect]
.}
Reads the whole header from HTTP response from server, returns the results.
> Note: Be careful to handle HTTP request which supported keep-alive. For persistent
connection via keep-alive, there are usually multiple requests.
  Source Edit

    void] {.

proc request(req: ClientRequest; port: Port; hostname = "127.0.0.1";
            domain = Domain.AF_INET): Future[void] {.
raises: [FutureError],
    tags: [RootEffect]
.}
Make a new HTTP connection if req is not connecting. Or close the conection and make a new connection if port,``hostname``,``domain`` changed. Or returns immediately.   Source Edit
